title: 111_s1937
content: 5-year carryback of operating losses. The text discusses amending the carryback period for 2008 and 2009 net operating losses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It involves substituting numbers in certain subparagraphs based on taxpayer elections. The text discusses amending the carryback period for 2008 and 2009 net operating losses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It involves substituting numbers in certain subparagraphs based on taxpayer elections. The term 'applicable 2008 or 2009 net operating loss' is defined as the taxpayer's net operating loss for any taxable year ending in 2008 or 2009. The taxpayer's net operating loss for taxable years 2008 or 2009 can be carried back under certain conditions. The election must be made by the due date for filing the tax return and is irrevocable once made. Coordination with alternative tax net operating loss deduction applies for those electing clause (ii)(II). The tax code is amended to allow for the carryback of net operating losses from taxable years ending during 2001, 2002, 2008, or 2009. Additionally, there are changes to the alternative tax net operating loss deduction and the loss from operations of life insurance companies. The tax code amendment allows for the carryback of net operating losses from 2008 or 2009. Taxpayers can elect to substitute '5' or '4' for '3' in the application of the loss deduction. The tax code amendment allows taxpayers to carry back net operating losses from 2008 or 2009 and make an irrevocable election by the due date for filing their return. Coordination with the alternative tax net operating loss deduction is also specified. The Secretary of Treasury will prescribe rules to prevent abuse of tax code amendments, including anti-stuffing and anti-churning rules. The effective dates for the amendments are after December 31, 2007, with an alternative tax net operating loss deduction applying after 1997. The amendment made by subsection (b) applies to taxable years ending after 1997, while the amendment made by subsection (d) applies to losses from operations in taxable years ending after December 31, 2007. A transitional rule allows for the revocation of certain elections for net operating losses before the enactment date of the Act. The amendment allows for timely filing of loss applications before the applicable date, defined as 60 days after the enactment of the Act. TARP recipients are exempt from these amendments if the Federal Government acquires an equity interest in them under the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008. The Federal Government acquires warrants to acquire equity interest under the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008. The Secretary of the Treasury transfers revenue reductions to the general fund. The Secretary of the Treasury transfers revenue reductions to the general fund resulting from amendments made by subsections (a) through (f) of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. Amounts are transferred from appropriated or unobligated funds under the Act.
